conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible top/side faces, angled camera, and ceiling/roof removed to show interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Scoring skipped due to automatic rejection (major room set missing vs 2D plan).

detected_errors.description: More than 50% of rooms/spaces from the 2D plan are missing or replaced: key labeled areas (kitchen, playroom, dining room, stairs, pantry) are not faithfully represented in the 3D model.

Overall layout fidelity is not preserved: the 3D render introduces mismatching room identities (e.g., bedroom/office-like setup) and does not maintain the 2D plan's room configuration and adjacencies.

summary: Although the second image is a real 3D cutaway, it fails as a faithful 2D-to-3D conversion because a majority of rooms from the original plan are missing or substantially altered.
